35
36static EGLint GetDepthSize(GLint internalformat)
37{
38 switch (internalformat)
39 {
40 case GL_STENCIL_INDEX8:
41 return 0;
42 case GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT16:
43 return 16;
44 case GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT24:
45 return 24;
46 case GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT32_OES:
47 return 32;
48 case GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT32F:
49 return 32;
50 case GL_DEPTH24_STENCIL8:
51 return 24;
52 case GL_DEPTH32F_STENCIL8:
53 return 32;
54 default:
55 // UNREACHABLE(internalformat);
56 return 0;
57 }
58}
59
60static EGLint GetStencilSize(GLint internalformat)
61{
62 switch (internalformat)
63 {
64 case GL_STENCIL_INDEX8:
65 return 8;
66 case GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT16:
67 return 0;
68 case GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT24:
69 return 0;
70 case GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT32_OES:
71 return 0;
72 case GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT32F:
73 return 0;
74 case GL_DEPTH24_STENCIL8:
75 return 8;
76 case GL_DEPTH32F_STENCIL8:
77 return 8;
78 default:
79 // UNREACHABLE(internalformat);
80 return 0;
81 }
82}
83
84bool IsMetalDisplayAvailable()
85{
86 // We only support macos 10.13+ and 11 for now. Since they are requirements for Metal 2.0.
87#if TARGET_OS_SIMULATOR
88 if (ANGLE_APPLE_AVAILABLE_XCI(10.13, 13.0, 13))
89#else
90 if (ANGLE_APPLE_AVAILABLE_XCI(10.13, 13.0, 11))
91#endif
92 {
93 return true;
94 }
95 return false;
96}
97
98DisplayImpl *CreateMetalDisplay(const egl::DisplayState &state)
99{
100 return new DisplayMtl(state);
101}
102
103struct DefaultShaderAsyncInfoMtl
104{
105 mtl::AutoObjCPtr<id<MTLLibrary>> defaultShaders;
106 mtl::AutoObjCPtr<NSError *> defaultShadersCompileError;
107
108 // Synchronization primitives for compiling default shaders in back-ground
109 std::condition_variable cv;
110 std::mutex lock;
111
112 bool compiled = false;
113};
114
115DisplayMtl::DisplayMtl(const egl::DisplayState &state)
116 : DisplayImpl(state), mStateCache(mFeatures), mUtils(this)
117{}
118
119DisplayMtl::~DisplayMtl() {}
120
121egl::Error DisplayMtl::initialize(egl::Display *display)
122{
123 ASSERT(IsMetalDisplayAvailable());
124
125 angle::Result result = initializeImpl(display);
126 if (result != angle::Result::Continue)
127 {
128 return egl::EglNotInitialized();
129 }
130 return egl::NoError();
131}
132
133angle::Result DisplayMtl::initializeImpl(egl::Display *display)
134{
135 ANGLE_MTL_OBJC_SCOPE
136 {
137 mMetalDevice = [getMetalDeviceMatchingAttribute(display->getAttributeMap()) ANGLE_MTL_AUTORELEASE];
138 //If we can't create a device, fail initialization.
139 if(!mMetalDevice.get())
140 {
141 return angle::Result::Stop;
142 }
143 mMetalDeviceVendorId = mtl::GetDeviceVendorId(mMetalDevice);
144
145 mCmdQueue.set([[mMetalDevice.get() newCommandQueue] ANGLE_MTL_AUTORELEASE]);
146
147 mCapsInitialized = false;
148#if ANGLE_ENABLE_METAL_SPIRV
149 if (!mGlslangInitialized)
150 {
151 GlslangInitialize();
152 mGlslangInitialized = true;
153 }
154#endif
155
156 if (!mState.featuresAllDisabled)
157 {
158 initializeFeatures();
159 }
160
161 ANGLE_TRY(mFormatTable.initialize(this));
162 ANGLE_TRY(initializeShaderLibrary());
163
164 return mUtils.initialize();
165 }
166}
167
168void DisplayMtl::terminate()
169{
170 mUtils.onDestroy();
171 mCmdQueue.reset();
172 mDefaultShadersAsyncInfo = nullptr;
173 mMetalDevice = nil;
174#if ANGLE_MTL_EVENT_AVAILABLE
175 mSharedEventListener = nil;
176#endif
177 mCapsInitialized = false;
178
179 mMetalDeviceVendorId = 0;
180#if ANGLE_ENABLE_METAL_SPIRV
181 if (mGlslangInitialized)
182 {
183 GlslangRelease();
184 mGlslangInitialized = false;
185 }
186#endif
187}
188
189bool DisplayMtl::testDeviceLost()
190{
191 return false;
192}
193
194egl::Error DisplayMtl::restoreLostDevice(const egl::Display *display)
195{
196 return egl::NoError();
197}
198
199std::string DisplayMtl::getVendorString() const
200{
201 ANGLE_MTL_OBJC_SCOPE
202 {
203 std::string vendorString = "Google Inc.";
204 if (mMetalDevice)
205 {
206 vendorString += " Metal Renderer: ";
207 vendorString += mMetalDevice.get().name.UTF8String;
208 }
209
210 return vendorString;
211 }
212}

214DeviceImpl *DisplayMtl::createDevice()
215{
216 UNIMPLEMENTED();
217 return nullptr;
218}
219
220egl::Error DisplayMtl::waitClient(const gl::Context *context)
221{
222 auto contextMtl = GetImplAs<ContextMtl>(context);
223 angle::Result result = contextMtl->finishCommandBuffer();
224
225 if (result != angle::Result::Continue)
226 {
227 return egl::EglBadAccess();
228 }
229 return egl::NoError();
230}

232egl::Error DisplayMtl::validateClientBuffer(const egl::Config *configuration,
233 EGLenum buftype,
234 EGLClientBuffer clientBuffer,
235 const egl::AttributeMap &attribs) const
236{
237 // TODO: Fill out properly
238 return egl::NoError();
239}
240
241
242id<MTLDevice> DisplayMtl::getMetalDeviceMatchingAttribute(const egl::AttributeMap &attribs)
243{
244#if defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_MACOS) || defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_MACCATALYST)
245 const std::string anglePreferredDevice = angle::GetEnvironmentVar(kANGLEPreferredDeviceEnv);
246 NSArray<id<MTLDevice>> *deviceList = MTLCopyAllDevices();
247 if (anglePreferredDevice != "")
248 {
249 for (id<MTLDevice> device in deviceList)
250 {
251 if ([device.name.lowercaseString
252 containsString:[NSString stringWithUTF8String:anglePreferredDevice.c_str()]
253 .lowercaseString])
254 {
255 NSLog(@"Using Metal Device: %@", [device name]);
256 return device;
257 break;
258 }
259 }
260 }
261
262 NSMutableArray<id<MTLDevice>> *externalGPUs = [[NSMutableArray alloc] init];
263 NSMutableArray<id<MTLDevice>> *integratedGPUs = [[NSMutableArray alloc] init];
264 NSMutableArray<id<MTLDevice>> *discreteGPUs = [[NSMutableArray alloc] init];
265 for (id <MTLDevice> device in deviceList) {
266 if (device.removable)
267 {
268 [externalGPUs addObject:device];
269 }
270 else if (device.lowPower)
271 {
272 [integratedGPUs addObject:device];
273 }
274 else
275 {
276 [discreteGPUs addObject:device];
277 }
278 }
279 //TODO: External GPU support. Do we prefer high power / low bandwidth for general WebGL applications?
280 // Can we support hot-swapping in GPU's?
281 if (attribs.get(EGL_POWER_PREFERENCE_ANGLE, EGL_LOW_POWER_ANGLE) == EGL_HIGH_POWER_ANGLE)
282 {
283 //Search for a discrete GPU first.
284 for (id<MTLDevice> device in discreteGPUs) {
285 if(![device isHeadless])
286 return device;
287 }
288 }
289 //If we've selected a low power device, look through integrated devices.
290 for (id<MTLDevice> device in integratedGPUs) {
291 if(![device isHeadless])
292 return device;
293 }
294 //If we selected a low power device and there's no low-power devices avaialble, return the first (default) device.
295 if(deviceList.count > 0)
296 return deviceList[0];
297#endif
298 //If we can't find anything, or are on a platform that doesn't support power options, create a default device.
299 return MTLCreateSystemDefaultDevice();
300}
301

305 UNIMPLEMENTED();
306 return egl::NoError();

309SurfaceImpl *DisplayMtl::createWindowSurface(const egl::SurfaceState &state,
310 EGLNativeWindowType window,
311 const egl::AttributeMap &attribs)
312{
313 return new WindowSurfaceMtl(this, state, window, attribs);
314}
315
316SurfaceImpl *DisplayMtl::createPbufferSurface(const egl::SurfaceState &state,
317 const egl::AttributeMap &attribs)
318{
319 return new PBufferSurfaceMtl(this, state, attribs);
320}
321
322SurfaceImpl *DisplayMtl::createPbufferFromClientBuffer(const egl::SurfaceState &state,
323 EGLenum buftype,
324 EGLClientBuffer clientBuffer,
325 const egl::AttributeMap &attribs)
326{
327 switch (buftype)
328 {
329 case EGL_IOSURFACE_ANGLE:
330 return new IOSurfaceSurfaceMtl(this, state, clientBuffer, attribs);
331 break;
332 default:
333 UNREACHABLE();
334 return nullptr;
335 }
336}

340 const egl::AttributeMap &attribs)
341{
342 UNIMPLEMENTED();
343 return static_cast<SurfaceImpl *>(0);
344}

356 const egl::Config *configuration,

370
371ExternalImageSiblingImpl *DisplayMtl::createExternalImageSibling(const gl::Context *context,
372 EGLenum target,
373 EGLClientBuffer buffer,
374 const egl::AttributeMap &attribs)
375{
376 switch (target)
377 {
378 case EGL_METAL_TEXTURE_ANGLE:
379 return new TextureImageSiblingMtl(buffer);
380
381 default:
382 UNREACHABLE();
383 return nullptr;
384 }
385}
386
387gl::Version DisplayMtl::getMaxSupportedESVersion() const
388{
389#if TARGET_OS_SIMULATOR
390 // Simulator should be able to support ES3, despite not supporting iOS GPU
391 // Family 3 in its entirety.
392 // FIXME: None of the feature conditions are checked for simulator support.
393 return gl::Version(3, 0);
394#else
395 if (supportsEitherGPUFamily(3, 1))
396 {
397 return gl::Version(3, 0);
398 }
399 return gl::Version(2, 0);
400#endif
401}
402
403gl::Version DisplayMtl::getMaxConformantESVersion() const
404{
405 return std::min(getMaxSupportedESVersion(), gl::Version(2, 0));
406}
407
408EGLSyncImpl *DisplayMtl::createSync(const egl::AttributeMap &attribs)
409{
410 return new EGLSyncMtl(attribs);
411}
412
413ShareGroupImpl *DisplayMtl::createShareGroup()
414{
415 return new ShareGroupImpl();
416}
417
418egl::Error DisplayMtl::makeCurrent(egl::Display *display,
419 egl::Surface *drawSurface,
420 egl::Surface *readSurface,
421 gl::Context *context)
422{
423 if (!context)
424 {
425 return egl::NoError();
426 }
427
428 return egl::NoError();
429}
430
431void DisplayMtl::generateExtensions(egl::DisplayExtensions *outExtensions) const
432{
433 outExtensions->flexibleSurfaceCompatibility = true;
434 outExtensions->iosurfaceClientBuffer = true;
435 outExtensions->surfacelessContext = true;
436 outExtensions->displayTextureShareGroup = true;
437 outExtensions->displaySemaphoreShareGroup = true;
438 outExtensions->mtlTextureClientBuffer = true;
439
440 if (mFeatures.hasEvents.enabled)
441 {
442 // MTLSharedEvent is only available since Metal 2.1
443 outExtensions->fenceSync = true;
444 outExtensions->waitSync = true;
445 }
446
447 // Note that robust resource initialization is not yet implemented. We only expose
448 // this extension so that ANGLE can be initialized in Chrome. WebGL will fail to use
449 // this extension (anglebug.com/4929)
450 outExtensions->robustResourceInitialization = true;
451 outExtensions->powerPreference = true;
452
453 // EGL_KHR_image
454 outExtensions->image = true;
455 outExtensions->imageBase = true;
456}
457
458void DisplayMtl::generateCaps(egl::Caps *outCaps) const {}
459
460void DisplayMtl::populateFeatureList(angle::FeatureList *features) {}
461
462#if TARGET_OS_MACCATALYST
463static bool needsEAGLOnMac()
464{
465#if defined(__arm64__) || defined(__aarch64__)
466 return true;
467#else
468 return false;
469#endif
470}
471#endif
472
473EGLenum DisplayMtl::EGLDrawingBufferTextureTarget()
474{
475#if TARGET_OS_MACCATALYST
476 if (needsEAGLOnMac())
477 return EGL_TEXTURE_2D;
478 return EGL_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE_ANGLE;
479#elif TARGET_OS_OSX
480 return EGL_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE_ANGLE;
481#else
482 return EGL_TEXTURE_2D;
483#endif
484}
485egl::ConfigSet DisplayMtl::generateConfigs()
486{
487 // NOTE(hqle): generate more config permutations
488 egl::ConfigSet configs;
489
490 const gl::Version &maxVersion = getMaxSupportedESVersion();
491 ASSERT(maxVersion >= gl::Version(2, 0));
492 bool supportsES3 = maxVersion >= gl::Version(3, 0);
493
494 egl::Config config;
495
496 // Native stuff
497 config.nativeVisualID = 0;
498 config.nativeVisualType = 0;
499 config.nativeRenderable = EGL_TRUE;
500
501 config.colorBufferType = EGL_RGB_BUFFER;
502 config.luminanceSize = 0;
503 config.alphaMaskSize = 0;
504
505 config.transparentType = EGL_NONE;
506
507 // Pbuffer
508 config.bindToTextureTarget = EGLDrawingBufferTextureTarget();
509 config.maxPBufferWidth = 4096;
510 config.maxPBufferHeight = 4096;
511 config.maxPBufferPixels = 4096 * 4096;
512
513 // Caveat
514 config.configCaveat = EGL_NONE;
515
516 // Misc
517 config.sampleBuffers = 0;
518 config.samples = 0;
519 config.level = 0;
520 config.bindToTextureRGB = EGL_FALSE;
521 config.bindToTextureRGBA = EGL_TRUE;
522
523 config.surfaceType = EGL_WINDOW_BIT | EGL_PBUFFER_BIT;
524
525#if TARGET_OS_OSX || TARGET_OS_MACCATALYST
526 config.minSwapInterval = 0;
527 config.maxSwapInterval = 1;
528#else
529 config.minSwapInterval = 1;
530 config.maxSwapInterval = 1;
531#endif
532
533 config.renderTargetFormat = GL_RGBA8;
534 config.depthStencilFormat = GL_DEPTH24_STENCIL8;
535
536 config.conformant = EGL_OPENGL_ES2_BIT | (supportsES3 ? EGL_OPENGL_ES3_BIT_KHR : 0);
537 config.renderableType = config.conformant;
538
539 config.matchNativePixmap = EGL_NONE;
540
541 config.colorComponentType = EGL_COLOR_COMPONENT_TYPE_FIXED_EXT;
542
543 // Buffer sizes
544 config.redSize = 8;
545 config.greenSize = 8;
546 config.blueSize = 8;
547 config.alphaSize = 8;
548 config.bufferSize = config.redSize + config.greenSize + config.blueSize + config.alphaSize;
549
550 // Tests like dEQP-GLES2.functional.depth_range.* assume EGL_DEPTH_SIZE is properly set even if
551 // renderConfig attributes are set to glu::RenderConfig::DONT_CARE
552 config.depthSize = GetDepthSize(config.depthStencilFormat);
553 config.stencilSize = GetStencilSize(config.depthStencilFormat);
554 configs.add(config);
555
556 return configs;
557}
558
559bool DisplayMtl::isValidNativeWindow(EGLNativeWindowType window) const
560{
561 ANGLE_MTL_OBJC_SCOPE
562 {
563 NSObject *layer = (__bridge NSObject *)(window);
564 return [layer isKindOfClass:[CALayer class]];
565 }
566}
567
568std::string DisplayMtl::getRendererDescription() const
569{
570 ANGLE_MTL_OBJC_SCOPE
571 {
572 std::string desc = "Metal Renderer";
573
574 if (mMetalDevice)
575 {
576 desc += ": ";
577 desc += mMetalDevice.get().name.UTF8String;
578 }
579
580 return desc;
581 }
582}
583
584egl::Error DisplayMtl::validateImageClientBuffer(const gl::Context *context,
585 EGLenum target,
586 EGLClientBuffer clientBuffer,
587 const egl::AttributeMap &attribs) const
588{
589 switch (target)
590 {
591 case EGL_METAL_TEXTURE_ANGLE:
592 if (!TextureImageSiblingMtl::ValidateClientBuffer(this, clientBuffer))
593 {
594 return egl::EglBadAttribute();
595 }
596 break;
597 default:
598 UNREACHABLE();
599 return egl::EglBadAttribute();
600 }
601 return egl::NoError();
602}
603
604gl::Caps DisplayMtl::getNativeCaps() const
605{
606 ensureCapsInitialized();
607 return mNativeCaps;
608}
609const gl::TextureCapsMap &DisplayMtl::getNativeTextureCaps() const
610{
611 ensureCapsInitialized();
612 return mNativeTextureCaps;
613}
614const gl::Extensions &DisplayMtl::getNativeExtensions() const
615{
616 ensureCapsInitialized();
617 return mNativeExtensions;
618}
619
620const gl::Limitations &DisplayMtl::getNativeLimitations() const
621{
622 ensureCapsInitialized();
623 return mNativeLimitations;
624}
625
626void DisplayMtl::ensureCapsInitialized() const
627{
628 if (mCapsInitialized)
629 {
630 return;
631 }
632
633 mCapsInitialized = true;
634
635 // Reset
636 mNativeCaps = gl::Caps();
637
638 // Fill extension and texture caps
639 initializeExtensions();
640 initializeTextureCaps();
641
642 // https://developer.apple.com/metal/Metal-Feature-Set-Tables.pdf
643 mNativeCaps.maxElementIndex = std::numeric_limits<GLuint>::max() - 1;
644 mNativeCaps.max3DTextureSize = 2048;
645#if TARGET_OS_OSX || TARGET_OS_MACCATALYST
646 mNativeCaps.max2DTextureSize = 16384;
647 // On macOS exclude [[position]] from maxVaryingVectors.
648 mNativeCaps.maxVaryingVectors = 31 - 1;
649 mNativeCaps.maxVertexOutputComponents = mNativeCaps.maxFragmentInputComponents = 124 - 4;
650#else
651 if (supportsIOSGPUFamily(3))
652 {
653 mNativeCaps.max2DTextureSize = 16384;
654 mNativeCaps.maxVertexOutputComponents = mNativeCaps.maxFragmentInputComponents = 124;
655 mNativeCaps.maxVaryingVectors = mNativeCaps.maxVertexOutputComponents / 4;
656 }
657 else
658 {
659 mNativeCaps.max2DTextureSize = 8192;
660 mNativeCaps.maxVertexOutputComponents = mNativeCaps.maxFragmentInputComponents = 60;
661 mNativeCaps.maxVaryingVectors = mNativeCaps.maxVertexOutputComponents / 4;
662 }
663#endif
664
665 mNativeCaps.maxArrayTextureLayers = 2048;
666 mNativeCaps.maxLODBias = 2.0; // default GLES3 limit
667 mNativeCaps.maxCubeMapTextureSize = mNativeCaps.max2DTextureSize;
668 mNativeCaps.maxRenderbufferSize = mNativeCaps.max2DTextureSize;
669 mNativeCaps.minAliasedPointSize = 1;
670 // NOTE(hqle): Metal has some problems drawing big point size even though
671 // Metal-Feature-Set-Tables.pdf says that max supported point size is 511. We limit it to 255
672 // on Intel and 64 on AMD for now.
673 if ([mMetalDevice.get().name rangeOfString:@"Intel"].location != NSNotFound)
674 {
675 mNativeCaps.maxAliasedPointSize = 255;
676 }
677 else
678 {
679 mNativeCaps.maxAliasedPointSize = 64;
680 }
681
682 mNativeCaps.minAliasedLineWidth = 1.0f;
683 mNativeCaps.maxAliasedLineWidth = 1.0f;
684
685 mNativeCaps.maxDrawBuffers = mtl::kMaxRenderTargets;
686 mNativeCaps.maxFramebufferWidth = mNativeCaps.max2DTextureSize;
687 mNativeCaps.maxFramebufferHeight = mNativeCaps.max2DTextureSize;
688 mNativeCaps.maxColorAttachments = mtl::kMaxRenderTargets;
689 mNativeCaps.maxViewportWidth = mNativeCaps.max2DTextureSize;
690 mNativeCaps.maxViewportHeight = mNativeCaps.max2DTextureSize;
691
692 // MSAA
693 mNativeCaps.maxSamples = mFormatTable.getMaxSamples();
694 mNativeCaps.maxSampleMaskWords = 0;
695 mNativeCaps.maxColorTextureSamples = mNativeCaps.maxSamples;
696 mNativeCaps.maxDepthTextureSamples = mNativeCaps.maxSamples;
697 mNativeCaps.maxIntegerSamples = 1;
698
699 mNativeCaps.maxVertexAttributes = mtl::kMaxVertexAttribs;
700 mNativeCaps.maxVertexAttribBindings = mtl::kMaxVertexAttribs;
701 mNativeCaps.maxVertexAttribRelativeOffset = std::numeric_limits<GLint>::max();
702 mNativeCaps.maxVertexAttribStride = std::numeric_limits<GLint>::max();
703
704 // glGet() use signed integer as parameter so we have to use GLint's max here, not GLuint.
705 mNativeCaps.maxElementsIndices = std::numeric_limits<GLint>::max();
706 mNativeCaps.maxElementsVertices = std::numeric_limits<GLint>::max();
707
708 // Looks like all floats are IEEE according to the docs here:
709 mNativeCaps.vertexHighpFloat.setIEEEFloat();
710 mNativeCaps.vertexMediumpFloat.setIEEEFloat();
711 mNativeCaps.vertexLowpFloat.setIEEEFloat();
712 mNativeCaps.fragmentHighpFloat.setIEEEFloat();
713 mNativeCaps.fragmentMediumpFloat.setIEEEFloat();
714 mNativeCaps.fragmentLowpFloat.setIEEEFloat();
715
716 mNativeCaps.vertexHighpInt.setTwosComplementInt(32);
717 mNativeCaps.vertexMediumpInt.setTwosComplementInt(32);
718 mNativeCaps.vertexLowpInt.setTwosComplementInt(32);
719 mNativeCaps.fragmentHighpInt.setTwosComplementInt(32);
720 mNativeCaps.fragmentMediumpInt.setTwosComplementInt(32);
721 mNativeCaps.fragmentLowpInt.setTwosComplementInt(32);
722
723 GLuint maxDefaultUniformVectors = mtl::kDefaultUniformsMaxSize / (sizeof(GLfloat));
724
725 const GLuint maxDefaultUniformComponents = maxDefaultUniformVectors;
726
727 // Uniforms are implemented using a uniform buffer, so the max number of uniforms we can
728 // support is the max buffer range divided by the size of a single uniform (1X float).
729 mNativeCaps.maxVertexUniformVectors = maxDefaultUniformVectors;
730 mNativeCaps.maxShaderUniformComponents[gl::ShaderType::Vertex] = maxDefaultUniformComponents;
731 mNativeCaps.maxFragmentUniformVectors = maxDefaultUniformVectors;
732 mNativeCaps.maxShaderUniformComponents[gl::ShaderType::Fragment] = maxDefaultUniformComponents;
733
734 mNativeCaps.maxShaderUniformBlocks[gl::ShaderType::Vertex] = mtl::kMaxShaderUBOs;
735 mNativeCaps.maxShaderUniformBlocks[gl::ShaderType::Fragment] = mtl::kMaxShaderUBOs;
736 mNativeCaps.maxCombinedUniformBlocks = mtl::kMaxGLUBOBindings;
737
738 // Note that we currently implement textures as combined image+samplers, so the limit is
739 // the minimum of supported samplers and sampled images.
740 mNativeCaps.maxCombinedTextureImageUnits = mtl::kMaxGLSamplerBindings;
741 mNativeCaps.maxShaderTextureImageUnits[gl::ShaderType::Fragment] = mtl::kMaxShaderSamplers;
742 mNativeCaps.maxShaderTextureImageUnits[gl::ShaderType::Vertex] = mtl::kMaxShaderSamplers;
743
744 // No info from Metal given, use default GLES3 spec values:
745 mNativeCaps.minProgramTexelOffset = -8;
746 mNativeCaps.maxProgramTexelOffset = 7;
747
748 // NOTE(hqle): support storage buffer.
749 const uint32_t maxPerStageStorageBuffers = 0;
750 mNativeCaps.maxShaderStorageBlocks[gl::ShaderType::Vertex] = maxPerStageStorageBuffers;
751 mNativeCaps.maxShaderStorageBlocks[gl::ShaderType::Fragment] = maxPerStageStorageBuffers;
752 mNativeCaps.maxCombinedShaderStorageBlocks = maxPerStageStorageBuffers;
753
754 // Fill in additional limits for UBOs and SSBOs.
755 mNativeCaps.maxUniformBufferBindings = mNativeCaps.maxCombinedUniformBlocks;
756 mNativeCaps.maxUniformBlockSize = mtl::kMaxUBOSize; // Default according to GLES 3.0 spec.
757 if([mMetalDevice supportsFamily:MTLGPUFamilyApple1])
758 {
759 mNativeCaps.uniformBufferOffsetAlignment = 16; // on Apple based GPU's We can ignore data types when setting constant buffer alignment at 16.
760 }
761 else{
762 mNativeCaps.uniformBufferOffsetAlignment = 256; // constant buffers on all other GPUs must be aligned to 256.
763 }
764
765 mNativeCaps.maxShaderStorageBufferBindings = 0;
766 mNativeCaps.maxShaderStorageBlockSize = 0;
767 mNativeCaps.shaderStorageBufferOffsetAlignment = 0;
768
769 // UBO plus default uniform limits
770 const uint32_t maxCombinedUniformComponents =
771 maxDefaultUniformComponents + mtl::kMaxUBOSize * mtl::kMaxShaderUBOs / 4;
772 for (gl::ShaderType shaderType : gl::kAllGraphicsShaderTypes)
773 {
774 mNativeCaps.maxCombinedShaderUniformComponents[shaderType] = maxCombinedUniformComponents;
775 }
776
777 mNativeCaps.maxCombinedShaderOutputResources = 0;
778
779 mNativeCaps.maxTransformFeedbackInterleavedComponents =
780 gl::IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_INTERLEAVED_COMPONENTS;
781 mNativeCaps.maxTransformFeedbackSeparateAttributes =
782 gl::IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_SEPARATE_ATTRIBS;
783 mNativeCaps.maxTransformFeedbackSeparateComponents =
784 gl::IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_SEPARATE_COMPONENTS;
785
786 // GL_OES_get_program_binary
787 mNativeCaps.programBinaryFormats.push_back(GL_PROGRAM_BINARY_ANGLE);
788
789 // GL_APPLE_clip_distance
790 mNativeCaps.maxClipDistances = 8;
791
792 // Metal doesn't support GL_TEXTURE_COMPARE_MODE=GL_NONE for shadow samplers
793 mNativeLimitations.noShadowSamplerCompareModeNone = true;
794}
795
796void DisplayMtl::initializeExtensions() const
797{
798 // Reset
799 mNativeExtensions = gl::Extensions();
800
801 // Enable this for simple buffer readback testing, but some functionality is missing.
802 // NOTE(hqle): Support full mapBufferRange extension.
803 mNativeExtensions.mapBufferOES = true;
804 mNativeExtensions.mapBufferRange = true;
805 mNativeExtensions.textureStorage = true;
806 mNativeExtensions.drawBuffers = true;
807 mNativeExtensions.fragDepth = true;
808 mNativeExtensions.framebufferBlit = true;
809 mNativeExtensions.framebufferMultisample = true;
810 mNativeExtensions.copyTexture = true;
811 mNativeExtensions.copyCompressedTexture = false;
812
813 // EXT_debug_marker is not implemented yet, but the entry points must be exposed for the Metal
814 // backend to be used in Chrome (http://anglebug.com/4946)
815 mNativeExtensions.debugMarker = true;
816
817 mNativeExtensions.robustness = true;
818 mNativeExtensions.textureBorderClampOES = false; // not implemented yet
819 mNativeExtensions.translatedShaderSource = true;
820 mNativeExtensions.discardFramebuffer = true;
821 // Not implemented but expose
822 mNativeExtensions.textureRectangle = true;
823
824 // EXT_multisampled_render_to_texture
825 if (mFeatures.allowMultisampleStoreAndResolve.enabled &&
826 mFeatures.hasDepthAutoResolve.enabled && mFeatures.hasStencilAutoResolve.enabled)
827 {
828 mNativeExtensions.multisampledRenderToTexture = true;
829 }
830
831 // Enable EXT_blend_minmax
832 mNativeExtensions.blendMinMax = true;
833
834 mNativeExtensions.eglImageOES = true;
835 mNativeExtensions.eglImageExternalOES = false;
836 // NOTE(hqle): Support GL_OES_EGL_image_external_essl3.
837 mNativeExtensions.eglImageExternalEssl3OES = false;
838
839 mNativeExtensions.memoryObject = false;
840 mNativeExtensions.memoryObjectFd = false;
841
842 mNativeExtensions.semaphore = false;
843 mNativeExtensions.semaphoreFd = false;
844
845 mNativeExtensions.instancedArraysANGLE = true;
846 mNativeExtensions.instancedArraysEXT = true;
847
848 mNativeExtensions.robustBufferAccessBehavior = false;
849
850 mNativeExtensions.eglSyncOES = false;
851
852 mNativeExtensions.occlusionQueryBoolean = true;
853
854 mNativeExtensions.disjointTimerQuery = false;
855 mNativeExtensions.queryCounterBitsTimeElapsed = false;
856 mNativeExtensions.queryCounterBitsTimestamp = false;
857
858 mNativeExtensions.textureFilterAnisotropic = true;
859 mNativeExtensions.maxTextureAnisotropy = 16;
860
861 mNativeExtensions.textureNPOTOES = true;
862
863 mNativeExtensions.texture3DOES = true;
864
865 mNativeExtensions.standardDerivativesOES = true;
866
867 mNativeExtensions.elementIndexUintOES = true;
868
869 // GL_OES_get_program_binary
870 mNativeExtensions.getProgramBinaryOES = true;
871
872 // GL_APPLE_clip_distance
873 mNativeExtensions.clipDistanceAPPLE = true;
874
875 // GL_NV_pixel_buffer_object
876 mNativeExtensions.pixelBufferObjectNV = true;
877
878 if (mFeatures.hasEvents.enabled)
879 {
880 // MTLSharedEvent is only available since Metal 2.1
881
882 // GL_NV_fence
883 mNativeExtensions.fenceNV = true;
884
885 // GL_OES_EGL_sync
886 mNativeExtensions.eglSyncOES = true;
887 }
888}
889
890void DisplayMtl::initializeTextureCaps() const
891{
892 mNativeTextureCaps.clear();
893
894 mFormatTable.generateTextureCaps(this, &mNativeTextureCaps,
895 &mNativeCaps.compressedTextureFormats);
896
897 // Re-verify texture extensions.
898 mNativeExtensions.setTextureExtensionSupport(mNativeTextureCaps);
899 // Modify extensions based off of support
900 // Disable all depth buffer and stencil buffer readback extensions until we need them
901 mNativeExtensions.readDepthNV = false;
902 mNativeExtensions.readStencilNV = false;
903 mNativeExtensions.depthBufferFloat2NV = false;
904 mNativeExtensions.textureCompressionASTCLDRKHR &= supportsIOSGPUFamily(2);
905}
906
907void DisplayMtl::initializeLimitations()
908{
909 mNativeLimitations.noVertexAttributeAliasing = true;
910}
911
912void DisplayMtl::initializeFeatures()
913{
914 bool isMetal2_1 = false;
915 bool isMetal2_2 = false;
916 if (ANGLE_APPLE_AVAILABLE_XCI(10.14, 13.0, 12.0))
917 {
918 isMetal2_1 = true;
919 }
920
921 if (ANGLE_APPLE_AVAILABLE_XCI(10.15, 13.0, 13.0))
922 {
923 isMetal2_2 = true;
924 }
925
926 bool isOSX = TARGET_OS_OSX;
927 bool isCatalyst = TARGET_OS_MACCATALYST;
928 bool isSimulator = TARGET_OS_SIMULATOR;
929 bool isARM = ANGLE_MTL_ARM;
930
931 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), allowGenMultipleMipsPerPass, true);
932 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), forceBufferGPUStorage, false);
933
934 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), hasDepthTextureFiltering,
935 (isOSX || isCatalyst) && !isARM);
936 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), hasExplicitMemBarrier,
937 isMetal2_1 && (isOSX || isCatalyst) && !isARM);
938 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), hasDepthAutoResolve, supportsEitherGPUFamily(3, 2));
939 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), hasStencilAutoResolve, supportsEitherGPUFamily(5, 2));
940 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), allowMultisampleStoreAndResolve,
941 supportsEitherGPUFamily(3, 1));
942
943 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), allowRuntimeSamplerCompareMode,
944 supportsEitherGPUFamily(3, 1));
945 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), allowSamplerCompareGradient, supportsEitherGPUFamily(3,1));
946 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), allowSamplerCompareLod, supportsEitherGPUFamily(3,1));
947
948 // http://anglebug.com/4919
949 // Stencil blit shader is not compiled on Intel & NVIDIA, need investigation.
950 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), hasStencilOutput,
951 isMetal2_1 && !isIntel() && !isNVIDIA());
952
953 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), hasTextureSwizzle,
954 isMetal2_2 && supportsEitherGPUFamily(3, 2) && !isSimulator);
955
956 // http://crbug.com/1136673
957 // Fence sync is flaky on Nvidia
958 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), hasEvents, isMetal2_1 && !isNVIDIA());
959
960 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), hasCheapRenderPass, (isOSX || isCatalyst) && !isARM);
961
962 // http://anglebug.com/5235
963 // D24S8 is unreliable on AMD.
964 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), forceD24S8AsUnsupported, isAMD());
965
966 // Base Vertex drawing is only supported since GPU family 3.
967 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), hasBaseVertexInstancedDraw,
968 isOSX || isCatalyst || supportsIOSGPUFamily(3));
969
970 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), hasNonUniformDispatch,
971 isOSX || isCatalyst || supportsIOSGPUFamily(4));
972
973 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), allowSeparatedDepthStencilBuffers,
974 !isOSX && !isCatalyst && !isSimulator);
975 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), rewriteRowMajorMatrices, true);
976 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), emulateTransformFeedback, true);
977
978 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), intelThinMipmapWorkaround, isIntel());
979 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFeatures), intelExplicitBoolCastWorkaround, isIntel() && GetMacOSVersion() < OSVersion(11, 0, 0));
980
981 angle::PlatformMethods *platform = ANGLEPlatformCurrent();
982 platform->overrideFeaturesMtl(platform, &mFeatures);
983
984 ApplyFeatureOverrides(&mFeatures, getState());
985}
986
987angle::Result DisplayMtl::initializeShaderLibrary()
988{
989#ifdef ANGLE_METAL_XCODE_BUILDS_SHADERS
990 mDefaultShadersAsyncInfo.reset(new DefaultShaderAsyncInfoMtl);
991
992 NSString *path = [NSBundle bundleWithIdentifier:@"com.apple.WebKit"].bundlePath;
993 NSError *error = nullptr;
994 mDefaultShadersAsyncInfo->defaultShaders =
995 [getMetalDevice() newDefaultLibraryWithBundle:[NSBundle bundleWithPath:path] error:&error];
996
997 if (error && !mDefaultShadersAsyncInfo->defaultShaders)
998 {
999 ANGLE_MTL_OBJC_SCOPE
1000 {
1001 ERR() << "Internal error: newDefaultLibraryWithBundle failed. "
1002 << error.localizedDescription.UTF8String;
1003 }
1004 mDefaultShadersAsyncInfo->defaultShadersCompileError = std::move(error);
1005 return angle::Result::Stop;
1006 }
1007 mDefaultShadersAsyncInfo->compiled = true;
1008
1009#else
1010 mDefaultShadersAsyncInfo.reset(new DefaultShaderAsyncInfoMtl);
1011
1012 // Create references to async info struct since it might be released in terminate(), but the
1013 // callback might still not be fired yet.
1014 std::shared_ptr<DefaultShaderAsyncInfoMtl> asyncRef = mDefaultShadersAsyncInfo;
1015
1016 // Compile the default shaders asynchronously
1017 ANGLE_MTL_OBJC_SCOPE
1018 {
1019 auto nsSource = [[NSString alloc] initWithBytesNoCopy:gDefaultMetallibSrc
1020 length:sizeof(gDefaultMetallibSrc)
1021 encoding:NSUTF8StringEncoding
1022 freeWhenDone:NO];
1023 auto options = [[[MTLCompileOptions alloc] init] ANGLE_MTL_AUTORELEASE];
1024 [getMetalDevice() newLibraryWithSource:nsSource
1025 options:options
1026 completionHandler:^(id<MTLLibrary> library, NSError *error) {
1027 std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lg(asyncRef->lock);
1028
1029 asyncRef->defaultShaders = std::move(library);
1030 asyncRef->defaultShadersCompileError = std::move(error);
1031
1032 asyncRef->compiled = true;
1033 asyncRef->cv.notify_one();
1034 }];
1035
1036 [nsSource ANGLE_MTL_AUTORELEASE];
1037 }
1038#endif
1039 return angle::Result::Continue;
1040}
1041
1042id<MTLLibrary> DisplayMtl::getDefaultShadersLib()
1043{
1044 std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lg(mDefaultShadersAsyncInfo->lock);
1045 if (!mDefaultShadersAsyncInfo->compiled)
1046 {
1047 // Wait for async compilation
1048 mDefaultShadersAsyncInfo->cv.wait(lg,
1049 [this] { return mDefaultShadersAsyncInfo->compiled; });
1050 }
1051
1052 if (mDefaultShadersAsyncInfo->defaultShadersCompileError &&
1053 !mDefaultShadersAsyncInfo->defaultShaders)
1054 {
1055 ANGLE_MTL_OBJC_SCOPE
1056 {
1057 ERR() << "Internal error: "
1058 << mDefaultShadersAsyncInfo->defaultShadersCompileError.get()
1059 .localizedDescription.UTF8String;
1060 }
1061 // This is not supposed to happen
1062 UNREACHABLE();
1063 }
1064
1065 return mDefaultShadersAsyncInfo->defaultShaders;
1066}
1067
1068bool DisplayMtl::supportsIOSGPUFamily(uint8_t iOSFamily) const
1069{
1070 return mtl::SupportsIOSGPUFamily(getMetalDevice(), iOSFamily);
1071}
1072
1073bool DisplayMtl::supportsMacGPUFamily(uint8_t macFamily) const
1074{
1075 return mtl::SupportsMacGPUFamily(getMetalDevice(), macFamily);
1076}
1077
1078bool DisplayMtl::supportsEitherGPUFamily(uint8_t iOSFamily, uint8_t macFamily) const
1079{
1080 return supportsIOSGPUFamily(iOSFamily) || supportsMacGPUFamily(macFamily);
1081}
1082
1083bool DisplayMtl::isAMD() const
1084{
1085 return angle::IsAMD(mMetalDeviceVendorId);
1086}
1087
1088bool DisplayMtl::isIntel() const
1089{
1090 return angle::IsIntel(mMetalDeviceVendorId);
1091}
1092
1093bool DisplayMtl::isNVIDIA() const
1094{
1095 return angle::IsNVIDIA(mMetalDeviceVendorId);
1096}
1097
1098#if ANGLE_MTL_EVENT_AVAILABLE
1099mtl::AutoObjCObj<MTLSharedEventListener> DisplayMtl::getOrCreateSharedEventListener()
1100{
1101 if (!mSharedEventListener)
1102 {
1103 ANGLE_MTL_OBJC_SCOPE
1104 {
1105 mSharedEventListener = [[[MTLSharedEventListener alloc] init] ANGLE_MTL_AUTORELEASE];
1106 ASSERT(mSharedEventListener); // Failure here most probably means a sandbox issue.
1107 }
1108 }
1109 return mSharedEventListener;
1110}
1111#endif
